@graph.parties: Covad Communications Co. v. Bell Atlantic Corp. (CADC)
@graph.reasoning: The complaint alleges that Verizon denied interconnection services to rivals in order to limit entry.

The offense requires, in addition to the possession of monopoly power in the relevant market, 'the willful acquisition or maintenance of that power as distinguished from growth or development as a consequence of a superior product, business acumen, or historic accident.'
Firms may acquire monopoly power by establishing an infrastructure that renders them uniquely suited to serve their customers.

@graph.caseNumber: Aspen Skiing Co. v. Aspen Highlands Skiing Corp.
@graph.parties: Aspen Skiing Co. v. Aspen Highlands Skiing Corp.
@graph.reasoning: Under certain circumstances, a refusal to cooperate with rivals can constitute anticompetitive conduct and violate ยง 2.

@graph.caseNumber: Verizon Communications Inc. v. Law Offices of Curtis V. Trinko, LLP
@graph.parties: Verizon Communications Inc. v. Law Offices of Curtis V. Trinko, LLP
@graph.reasoning: The refusal to deal alleged in the present case does not fit within the limited exception recognized in Aspen Skiing.
